definition: to have exclusive selling rights/to be the sole agent for a production unit or firm
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: And in this sense, the study of commercial property underwriting is necessary and of great significance.
sentences.chinese: 因此对商品房包销行为的研究具有现实的意义。

sentences.english: The corporation records the issuance of the bonds at the net amount received from the underwriter .
sentences.chinese: 发行公司只记录从证券包销商处收到的现金净值。

sentences.english: The issue is underwrite by three underwriting company.
sentences.chinese: 三家包销公司承购了发行的股票。

sentences.english: State-owned military enterprises are no longer the purchase processing workshops of the state.
sentences.chinese: 国有军工企业不再是国家统购包销的加工车间。

sentences.english: No Western bank agreed to hard underwrite the offers.
sentences.chinese: 没有哪家西方投行同意对这些交易实行硬包销。

definition: to undertake to purchase sth/to subscribe (to share issue)
to underwrite (i.e. guarantee financing)/underwriting/to sell as agent/consignee
to sell as agent/to sell on commission (e.g. insurance policies)/proxy sale (of stocks)
to ration merchandise (esp. food in times of shortages)
to order goods/to place an order
